service: The Nova Act service provides a REST API for managing AI-powered workflow automation. It enables users to create workflow definitions, execute workflow runs, manage sessions, and orchestrate acts (individual AI tasks) with tool integrations.

operations.CreateAct: Creates a new AI task (act) within a session that can interact with tools and perform specific actions.
operations.CreateSession: Creates a new session context within a workflow run to manage conversation state and acts.
operations.CreateWorkflowDefinition: Creates a new workflow definition template that can be used to execute multiple workflow runs.
operations.CreateWorkflowRun: Creates a new execution instance of a workflow definition with specified parameters.
operations.DeleteWorkflowDefinition: Deletes a workflow definition and all associated resources. This operation cannot be undone.
operations.DeleteWorkflowRun: Terminates and cleans up a workflow run, stopping all associated acts and sessions.
operations.GetWorkflowDefinition: Retrieves the details and configuration of a specific workflow definition.
operations.GetWorkflowRun: Retrieves the current state, configuration, and execution details of a workflow run.
operations.InvokeActStep: Executes the next step of an act, processing tool call results and returning new tool calls if needed.
operations.ListActs: Lists all acts within a specific session with their current status and execution details.
operations.ListModels: Lists all available AI models that can be used for workflow execution, including their status and compatibility information.
operations.ListSessions: Lists all sessions within a specific workflow run.
operations.ListWorkflowDefinitions: Lists all workflow definitions in your account with optional filtering and pagination.
operations.ListWorkflowRuns: Lists all workflow runs for a specific workflow definition with optional filtering and pagination.
operations.UpdateAct: Updates an existing act's configuration, status, or error information.
operations.UpdateWorkflowRun: Updates the configuration or state of an active workflow run.

AccessDeniedException.base: You don't have sufficient permissions to perform this action.

ActError.base: Error information when an act fails to execute successfully.

refs.UpdateActRequest$error: Error information to associate with the act, if applicable.

refs.ActError$message: A human-readable description of the error that occurred.

refs.ActError$type: The type or category of error that occurred.

refs.ActSummary$status: The current execution status of the act.
refs.CreateActResponse$status: The initial status of the act after creation.
refs.UpdateActRequest$status: The new status to set for the act.

refs.ListActsResponse$actSummaries: A list of summary information for acts in the session.

ActSummary.base: Summary information about an act, including its status and execution timing.

Call.base: A request for the client to execute a specific tool with given parameters.

refs.Call$callId: A unique identifier for this tool call, used to match results back to requests.
refs.CallResult$callId: The identifier of the tool call that this result corresponds to.

CallResult.base: The result returned from executing a tool call.

CallResultContent.base: Content returned from a tool call execution.

refs.CallResult$content: The content returned by the tool execution, which can include text or other media types.

refs.InvokeActStepRequest$callResults: The results from previous tool calls that the act requested.

refs.InvokeActStepResponse$calls: A list of tool calls that the act wants to execute in this step.

ClientInfo.base: Information about the client making API requests, used for compatibility checking.

refs.CreateWorkflowRunRequest$clientInfo: Information about the client making the request, including compatibility version and SDK version.

refs.CreateActRequest$clientToken: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
refs.CreateSessionRequest$clientToken: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
refs.CreateWorkflowDefinitionRequest$clientTo: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
refs.CreateWorkflowRunRequest$clientToken: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

refs.CreateWorkflowRunRequest$logGroupName: The CloudWatch log group name for storing workflow execution logs.
refs.GetWorkflowRunResponse$logGroupName: The CloudWatch log group name for this workflow run's logs.

CompatibilityInformation.base: Information about client compatibility and supported model versions.

refs.ListModelsResponse$compatibilityInformat: Information about client compatibility and supported models.

ConflictException.base: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

refs.ActSummary$startedAt: The timestamp when the act started execution.
refs.ActSummary$endedAt: The timestamp when the act completed execution, if applicable.
refs.GetWorkflowDefinitionResponse$createdAt: The timestamp when the workflow definition was created.
refs.GetWorkflowRunResponse$startedAt: The timestamp when the workflow run started execution.
refs.GetWorkflowRunResponse$endedAt: The timestamp when the workflow run completed execution, if applicable.

refs.WorkflowRunSummary$startedAt: The timestamp when the workflow run started execution.
refs.WorkflowRunSummary$endedAt: The timestamp when the workflow run completed execution, if applicable.

refs.ClientInfo$compatibilityVersion: The compatibility version of the client, used to ensure API compatibility.
refs.CompatibilityInformation$clientCompatibi: The client compatibility version that was requested.
refs.InternalServerException$retryAfterSecond: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request.
refs.ListModelsRequest$clientCompatibilityVer: The client compatibility version to filter models by compatibility.
refs.ModelSummary$minimumCompatibilityVersion: The minimum client compatibility version required to use this model.

refs.WorkflowExportConfig$s3BucketName: The name of your Amazon S3 bucket, that Nova Act uses to export your workflow data. Note that the IAM role used to access Nova Act must also have write permissions to this bucket.

S3KeyPrefix.base: A prefix for S3 object keys that will be prepended to 'step_{N}.json'. Must follow S3 object key naming guidelines and cannot end with a forward slash as it will be directly concatenated with the filename.

refs.WorkflowExportConfig$s3KeyPrefix: An optional prefix for Amazon S3 object keys to organize exported data.

refs.Call$input: The input parameters for the tool call, formatted according to the tool's schema.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.base: The request would exceed a service quota limit.

refs.ListSessionsResponse$sessionSummaries: A list of summary information for sessions in the workflow run.

SessionSummary.base: Summary information about a session within a workflow run.

refs.ListActsRequest$sortOrder: The sort order for the returned acts (ascending or descending).
refs.ListSessionsRequest$sortOrder: The sort order for the returned sessions (ascending or descending).
refs.ListWorkflowDefinitionsRequest$sortOrder: The sort order for the returned workflow definitions (ascending or descending).
refs.ListWorkflowRunsRequest$sortOrder: The sort order for the returned workflow runs (ascending or descending).

refs.Call$name: The name of the tool to invoke, following the pattern 'tool.{toolName}' or 'browser.{browserAction}'.
refs.CallResultContent$text: Text content returned from the tool execution.

refs.CreateActRequest$task: The task description that defines what the act should accomplish.

refs.ToolSpec$inputSchema: The JSON schema that defines the expected input format for the tool.

refs.ToolInputSchema$json: The JSON schema that defines the expected input format for the tool.

refs.ToolSpec$name: The unique name of the tool that acts will use to invoke it.

ToolSpec.base: Specification for a tool that acts can invoke, including its name, description, and input schema.

refs.CreateActRequest$toolSpecs: A list of tool specifications that the act can invoke to complete its task.
